member.name: M:OpenDental.Bridges.TigerView.SendData

member.name: T:OpenDental.DataClass
member.summary: This is the parent of all data classes.
member.remarks: Every database table has a corresponding struct of the same or similar name. For instance, the claim table has the Claim struct which can store each of the individual values for a single claim row. Each table also has a class with the same or similar name with an 's' on the end, for instance, the Claims class. These classes all inherit from this DataClass, which means they all have access to the members of this class. So there are roughly 60 of theses classes, one for every table plus a few extra. Every query to the database goes through the corresponding class using the data connection members of this parent class. Usually, FillTable will fill table with data from the database. Then a class like claims will copy the data into an array of type claim. The name of the array is usually List for each of the different classes, for instance Claims.List.

member.name: F:OpenDental.DataClass.con

member.summary: Stores the string of the command that will be sent to the database.

member.name: M:OpenDental.DataClass.FillTable
member.summary: Fills table with data from the database.

member.name: M:OpenDental.DataClass.FillDataSet
member.summary: Used to retrieve multiple tables from the database.
member.remarks: The driver did not used to be good enough to retreive datasets, but now that it is, we are trying to slowly transition to using this method to reduce the number of queries that have to be sent.

member.summary: Sends a non query command to the database.
member.param: If true, then InsertID will be set to the value of the primary key of the newly inserted row.

member.summary: Used to send batch SQL Select statements.
member.remarks: this is a first attempt at batch commands and it needs some refining. The huge advantage is that it only involves ONE round trip to the database.

member.param: A simple string with the names of each table separated by commas.
member.remarks: Would like to eliminate the switch statement from this class and replace it with a more flexible strategy possibly using reflection.

member.name: T:OpenDental.CovPat
member.summary: Corresponds to the covpat table in the database.
member.remarks: Coverage percentage for a patient. Each entry in this table is a single percentage value. A covpat can have a value in ONLY ONE of these three fields: PlanNum, PriPatNum, or SecPatNum. If it is for a PlanNum, then the percentage is attached to an insurance plan. If it is one of the others, then it is attached to the coverage for a patient, either primary or secondary, and overrides the plan percentage.

member.name: F:OpenDental.CovPat.SecPatNum
member.summary: OPT 3: Foreign key to patient.PatNum for secondary coverage.

member.name: F:OpenDental.CovPat.Percent
member.summary: Valid values are 0 to 100. If unknown, the covpat is simply deleted.

members.member: Handles database commands related to the definition table in the db.\ This class is referenced frequently from many different areas of the program. It stores data from the definition table in a couple of two dimensional arrays for immediate retrieval.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Defs.List
member.summary: For only one category. Only used in FormDefinitions.

member.summary: Current definition.

member.summary: Will probably be phased out.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Defs.Selected
member.summary: Will probably be phased out.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Defs.Short
member.summary: Stores all defs in a 2D array except the hidden ones.
member.remarks: The first dimension is the category, in int format. The second dimension is the index of the definition in this category. This is dependent on how it was refreshed, and not on what is in the database. If you need to reference a specific def, then the DefNum is more effective.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Defs.Long
member.summary: Stores all defs in a 2D array.

member.name: T:OpenDental.Def
member.summary: Corresponds to the definition table in the database.
member.remarks: Almost every table in the database links to definition. Almost all links to this table will be to a DefNum. Using the DefNum, you can find any of the other fields of interest, usually the ItemName. Make sure to look at the Defs class to see how the definitions are loaded into memory ahead of time.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Def.DefNum

member.name: F:OpenDental.Def.ItemColor
member.summary: Some categories include a color option.

member.summary: If hidden, the item will not show on any list, but can still be referenced.

member.name: M:OpenDental.InsPlans.Refresh(System.Int32)

member.name: M:OpenDental.InsPlans.GetInsRem(System.DateTime,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Get insurance benefits remaining for one benefit year. ClaimProcs and InsPlans must be refreshed first. Returns acutal remaining insurance based on ClaimProc data, taking into account inspayed and ins pending.
member.param: Used to determine which benefit year to calc. Usually today's date.
The insplan.PlanNum to get value for.
ClaimNum to exclude, or enter -1 to include all.

member.name: M:OpenDental.InsPlans.GetPending(System.DateTime,System.Int32)
member.summary: Get pending insurance for a given plan for one benefit year. ClaimProcs,InsPlans must be refreshed first.
member.param: Used to determine which benefit year to calc. Usually today's date.
The insplan.PlanNum to retreive insurance info for.
member.returns: Returns the amount of insurance pending based on ClaimProc data.

member.name: M:OpenDental.InsPlans.GetDedRem(System.DateTime,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the deductible remaining for an insurance plan for one benefit year which includes the given date. ClaimProcs,InsPlans must be refreshed first. You can exclude a claim or use -1 to include all.

member.name: M:OpenDental.InsPlans.GetCopay(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns -1 for no copay feeschedule, or 0 or more for a patient copay. Can handle a planNum of 0.

member.summary: Not used anymore since insplans and claims can use information from other families.

member.name: T:OpenDental.Reporting.DataDefinition
member.summary: Contains collections of all the FieldDefinition objects in an ODReport. These are generally read-only. The best place to access them is directly from the FieldObject which has a property called DataSource. DataSource can be an instance of any of the classes derived from FieldDefinition.

member.name: T:OpenDental.Reporting.FieldDefinition
member.summary: Base class providing generic properties for various kinds of field definition objects. Used to describe the data for a fieldObject. Use the constructor for each inherited class instead of creating an instance of this class.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Reporting.FieldDefinition.Kind
member.summary: The kind of field. The inherited type of FieldDefinition, like FormulaField or DataTableField.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Reporting.FieldDefinition.FormulaName
member.summary: The field definition unique formula name as used in other formulas. It includes the curly brackets and the preceding ? or @. For instance: {?SomeParameter} or {@SomeFormula} or {SomeDataField}. It does not have to match the ReportObject Name, but it does have to be unique.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Reporting.FieldDefinition.Name
member.summary: This is not the same as the ReportObject Name. This is the Formula name without any of the punctuation. For instance, if the FormulaName is {?SomeParameter}, than the Name of the FieldDefinition would be SomeParameter. For a dataTableField, this would be the column name.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Reporting.FieldDefinition.ValueType
member.summary: The value type of field, like string or datetime.

member.name: T:OpenDental.Reporting.FieldKind
member.summary: Specifies the field kind in the Kind property of the FieldDefinition class and all classes derived from FieldDefinition.

member.name: T:OpenDental.Reporting.FieldValueType
member.summary: Specifies the field value type in the ValueType property of the FieldDefinition class.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Reporting.FieldValueType.BooleanField
member.summary: Field contains either a true or false value, or a 1 or 0.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Reporting.FieldValueType.DoubleField
member.summary: Field contains a double value, typically used for currency. Can be shown with or without decimals or currency symbol.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Reporting.FieldValueType.DateTimeField
member.summary: Field contains a DateTime value. If only the date or time are needed, then the other part of the value is simply ignored.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Reporting.FieldValueType.EnumField
member.summary: Field contains an enumeration (values represented by numbers in the database) The string representation of the value will be shown in this field. Specify the type of enumeration in the EnumType field of the FieldObject.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Reporting.FieldValueType.IntField
member.summary: Field contains an integer with a value between -2147483648 and 2147483647.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Reporting.FieldValueType.PatNumField
member.summary: Field contains a PatNum which will be displayed as LName, FName. This reduces the number of joins required in an SQL statement.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Reporting.FieldValueType.StringField
member.summary: Field contains string data.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Reporting.FieldObject.DataSource

member.name: F:OpenDental.Reporting.FieldObject.FormatString
member.summary: A C# format string that specifies how to print dates, times, numbers, and currency based on the country or on a custom format.
member.remarks: There are a LOT of options for this string. Look in C# help under Standard Numeric Format Strings, Custom Numeric Format Strings, Standard DateTime Format Strings, Custom DateTime Format Strings, and Enumeration Format Strings. Once users are allowed to edit reports, we will assemble a help page with all of the common options. The best options are "n" for number, and "d" for date.
